p: Welcome to the official Aincrad RPG Wiki for version 1.1! This community-created resource aims to help new and existing players navigate the rich world of Aincrad.

Aincrad is a custom Tibia server that transforms the traditional Tibia gameplay into a full-fledged RPG experience. With unique systems like Ancestral Rifts, Aincrad vocations, gear scores, prestige levels, and much more, Aincrad offers a fresh take on the classic MMORPG formula.

Aincrad Lore & History Discover the world of Aincrad—the floating castle from Sword Art Online. Learn about the 100-floor tower, floor progression, and the elite players known as Clearers who push forward to clear new floors.

Getting Started Guide Your first steps into Aincrad: download the launcher, create an account, choose your vocation, and begin your adventure. Complete tutorial quests and prepare for your first floor boss encounter.
Vocations Guide Learn about the available Aincrad vocations and choose the one that fits your playstyle. Each vocation offers unique strengths, abilities, and combat styles.
This community-maintained wiki serves as a comprehensive resource for players of the Aincrad RPG custom Tibia server.
Our goal is to provide accurate, up-to-date information about all aspects of Aincrad, helping new and veteran players alike navigate the complex systems and rich content the server offers.
This wiki is an open project that welcomes contributions from all players. Learn how to contribute.
Have questions or suggestions about the wiki? Join our Discord channel or open an issue on GitHub.
Welcome to Aincrad RPG! This section will guide you through everything you need to know as a new player.
Download the latest Aincrad launcher to get started:
Download and install the Aincrad launcher
Create your first character (choose your vocation: Knight, Paladin, Sorcerer, or Druid)
Explore the first floor and complete tutorial quests
Reach level 20 to receive your vocation-specific starter kit and directions to the first floor boss
Focus on completing the tutorial quests in the starting area. These will give you essential equipment and teach you the game basics.

Upon reaching level 20, you'll receive a vocation-specific starter kit (including item upgrades and a promotion) and directions to the first floor boss. Proceed with caution- floor bosses are powerful enemies that require preparation and often a party to defeat. Make sure you're well-equipped and ready before attempting the boss.
Welcome to Aincrad, the floating castle from Sword Art Online—a 100-floor tower where adventurers must fight their way to the top.

Aincrad is a massive floating castle suspended in the sky, consisting of 100 distinct floors. Each floor represents a unique environment with its own challenges, monsters, and treasures. The tower was created as the setting for an epic MMORPG adventure.
Each floor of Aincrad presents unique challenges:
Lower Floors (1-20): Beginner areas with basic monsters and quests
Mid Floors (21-50): Increasing difficulty with stronger enemies
Upper Floors (51-75): Dangerous territories requiring skilled parties
High Floors (76-99): Elite areas with powerful bosses
Floor 100: The final challenge—the ultimate boss awaits
Elite players who push forward to clear new floors are known as "Clearers." These brave adventurers face the most dangerous content, paving the way for others to progress.
Floor Bosses- Each floor has a powerful boss that must be defeated
Safe Zones- Towns and cities are safe from PvP and monster attacks
Unique Systems- Ancestral Rifts, vocations, and crafting add depth to the Aincrad experience
Progression- Advance through floors by defeating bosses and completing challenges
Form parties with other players. Teamwork makes clearing floors much easier and more efficient.
Aincrad uses a classic vocation system. Choose your vocation to define your character's role, abilities, and playstyle.
Each vocation has unique strengths, weaknesses, and specializations. Your choice of vocation determines:
Combat style- Melee, ranged, or magic
Spell arsenal- Unique spells and abilities
Stat progression- How your character's attributes grow
Equipment preferences- Optimal gear for your playstyle

Choose your vocation carefully when creating your character. While you can create multiple characters, each vocation offers a unique gameplay experience. Knights excel in close combat, Paladins are versatile ranged fighters, Sorcerers deal massive magic damage, and Druids provide essential support and healing.
The frontline warrior specializing in melee combat with high health and strong physical attacks. Perfect for players who enjoy tanking and close-quarters combat.
A balanced vocation that excels at ranged combat with both physical and magical capabilities. Ideal for versatile players who want flexibility.
A powerful magic user specializing in destructive spells and area-of-effect damage. Best for players who enjoy high damage output and spellcasting.
The support vocation specializing in healing, utility spells, and nature-based magic. Essential for players who enjoy supporting teammates.
You choose your vocation when creating your character. This is a permanent choice for that character, so consider:
Playstyle preference- Do you prefer melee, ranged, or magic?
Role preference- Do you want to tank, deal damage, or support?
Group composition- What does your team need?
A vocation-specific starter kit containing item upgrades and a promotion
Directions to locate the first floor boss
The first floor boss is a powerful enemy. Make sure you're well-equipped and consider forming a party before attempting to fight it. Preparation is key to success.
You can create multiple characters with different vocations to experience all playstyles. Each character progresses independently.
Support vocation specializing in healing, utility spells, and nature-based magic.
Can heal, buff, and deal damage
Focus: Magic level, healing power, mana
Exevo Mas Frigo - Area ice attack
Keep your party alive first. You can deal damage when safe, but healing is priority. Monitor party HP and mana.
Druids are always in demand for group content. Your healing makes you highly valuable.
Powerful magic user specializing in destructive spells and area-of-effect damage.
Focus: Magic level, spell damage, mana
Exori Gran Vis - Strong energy attack
Exevo Gran Vis Lux - Massive energy burst
Exevo Gran Mas Flam - Area fire attack
Most fragile vocation. Keep distance from enemies. High damage = low survivability.
Focus on magic level and spell damage. Kill enemies before they reach you. Always carry mana potions.
Balanced vocation that excels at ranged combat with both physical and magical damage.
Jack of all trades, master of none
Needs both physical and magic equipment
Exevo Mas San - Area holy attack
Master kiting - attack from range while moving. Keep arrows/bolts stocked and manage mana for healing.
Frontline warrior specializing in melee combat with high HP and physical damage.
Prioritize HP and defense. Your job is to survive and protect the party, not deal the most damage.
Discover the unique gameplay systems and features that set Aincrad apart from other Tibia servers.
This server adds a Path-of-Exile–style item layer on top of normal Tibia/Aincrad items.
Every eligible equipment item can have:
Quality(0–20): scales the item's base stats
Modifiers: extra stats that change how your attacks and spells behave
This guide explains what these mean, how they work, and how crafting currencies interact with them.
Not every item can roll these properties.
Ammo (excluded from quality scaling and usually excluded from properties)
If an item is not eligible, it simply won't gain these properties.
Quality increases an item's base stats by a percentage.
It does not change the item's modifiers. Quality only scales what the item already "is" underneath.
Depending on the item type, Quality can scale:
Weapon Attack(physical and the native elemental portion)
Quality scaling always moves values in the "stronger" direction:
Positive values increase using half-up rounding
Negative values move toward 0(less negative), never further away
Rarity determines how many modifiers an item can have.
You can't have more modifiers than your rarity allows.
Modifiers are extra properties on top of the base item. They come in two types:
Add a fixed amount to stats.
Percent modifiers scale a base that includes the item's native/base contribution(not only "other modifiers").
Here are some examples of the modifiers available in the system:

This table shows a sample of available modifiers. The full system includes modifiers for all seven elements (energy, fire, ice, earth, holy, death, physical) across multiple categories. Modifier values scale with item tier/level.
Modifiers can apply differently depending on whether the damage comes from an Attack or a Spell.
An Attack is a weapon-driven hit:
Wand hits (their on-hit element is still an "attack source")
A Spell is something you cast:
Rune-like spell effects (if treated as spells)
A hit can have multiple elemental components (physical, fire, ice, energy, etc.).
If a modifier adds an element, and the hit does not already have that element component:
The element component is created, as long as the modifier matches the hit's source type(attack vs spell).
+10 fire attack damage on a pure physical sword hit:
Creates a fire component and adds +10 fire to it
A wand that normally deals energy(attack source)
The hit keeps its energy component
And gains a new fire component (+10)
+10% fire damage applies to fire damage from attacks and spells.
Applies only to attack hits(weapon-based hits)
Adds +10 to the hit's fire component
If the hit has no fire component, it creates one
Example: Wand of Vortex (base energy hit) Result: energy base+ new fire component
Applies only to spell hits(casted spells)
Adds +10 to the spell's fire component
If the spell has no fire component, it creates one
Example: exori hur that normally deals physical Result: physical base+ new fire component
Applies to all fire damage, regardless of source:
Scales the total fire base (native + flat adds)
These currencies mutate rarity, modifiers, and quality(when allowed by item eligibility).
You can only change Quality/Rarity/Modifiers while the item is NOT equipped.
Add second modifier to Magic items
Exact drop rates and some rule details are server-tuned.
Improve base stats on good items
Improve values on good modifier types
Increases Quality by 1 (max 20). Scales base stats only.
Magic → Rare. Adds +1 modifier, keeps existing.
Normal → Rare. Rolls up to 3 modifiers.
Normal → Uncommon or Magic (random). Grants 1-2 modifiers.
Remove bad modifiers before adding new ones
Removes all modifiers, resets to Normal.
Reroll bad modifiers on Magic items
Rerolls all modifiers and rarity. Can upgrade tier.
Rerolls all modifiers. Keeps same rarity.
Rerolls modifier values only. Keeps modifier types.
Upgrade to Rare without losing modifiers
Upgrade white items to get modifiers
Quality, rarity, and modifier changes are blocked if the item is in a real equipment slot.
If it's equipped: the currency/action fails
Unequip it first, then try again
Modifiers add or scale extra effects
Quality does not multiply modifier values
Physical sword hit with +10 fire attack damage:
+10 fire spell damage affects exori casts, not sword swings
+10 fire attack damage affects sword swings, not exori
+10% fire damage affects both (any fire component)
Aincrad is a custom Tibia server based on protocol 10.98, featuring unique RPG elements like Aincrad vocations, rifts, and advanced progression systems beyond traditional leveling.
Yes, Aincrad is completely free to download and play. The server is open to everyone and can be played online or locally.

l: How do I download and install Aincrad?
p: Download the Aincrad launcher from the download page. The launcher will handle the installation and setup for you.

l: How do I choose my vocation?
p: You choose your vocation when creating your character. This choice is permanent for that character, so choose based on your preferred playstyle.
Visit the Vocations Guide to learn about all available vocations and find the one that fits your playstyle.

At level 20, you'll receive a vocation-specific starter kit (including item upgrades and a promotion) and directions to the first floor boss. Be cautious- floor bosses are powerful and often require a party to defeat. Make sure you're well-prepared before attempting the boss.

l: What is the Gear Score system?
p: Gear Score represents the quality of your equipment. Each piece of gear contributes points to your total score, which determines access to certain areas and content.

l: How do I access Ancestral Rifts?
p: Complete "The First Fragment" quest to unlock the Ancestral Rifts system. You'll need to achieve specific Ancestral Rankings to access higher-tier rifts.
Each World Boss has a specific day and time of the week when it appears. Check the in-game announcements for the complete schedule.

l: What client version does Aincrad use?
p: Aincrad uses a custom client based on Tibia protocol 10.98.

l: I'm experiencing lag/crashes. How can I fix this?
p: Try restarting your client, checking your internet connection, or contacting support on Discord for assistance with technical issues.

l: Can I play Aincrad on my Mac/Linux computer?
p: Yes, Aincrad supports Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems.

This wiki is an open project that welcomes contributions from all players. If you'd like to help improve the wiki:
Create a fork of the repository
Make your changes and submit a pull request
Wiki maintainers will review and merge your contributions
New guides- Help document game features, quests, or mechanics
Updates- Keep existing information accurate and up-to-date
Corrections- Fix errors or clarify confusing information
Translations- Help make the wiki accessible to more players
If you're unsure about how to contribute or have questions, feel free to open an issue on GitHub or ask in our Discord channel.
